pr_title: Reject subscriptions to topics that don't exist

timeline.message:
Reject topics that don't exist

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: q: can results be cached? So in the cases of repeated calls we don't waste db resources checking

replies.bodyText:
We can only cache the existence of an entity. Caching the non-existence of an entity would introduce additional delays to being able to subscribe after create and risk causing further issues with when to invalidate the cache.
Caching with Flux is a bit more complex than I thought. Spring does not support @Cacheable with Flux, so you have to use reactor-extra with its CacheMono and a cache library like Caffeine.
After attempting it, I found that it does cache the non-existence of entities in addition to existence. I'm not sure how to tweak it to not do that, so don't think I can do this recommendation at this time.
